answers.answer: Many people get the pregestastional diabetes when pregnant.  It will go away after the baby born.  If you google you will find all the info you n eed.  Good LUck!!

I honestly don't know much about this.  If it is gestational diabetes, then it will clear up after the baby is born.  If you are concerned that you may have actual diabetes that was not diagnosed, I think you need to have that conversation with your Dr.  But don't worry too much about gestational diabetes.  As Kricket said, many women get this and if you follow your diet or take your insulin as instructed, all typically turns out just fine.

question: I am pregnant and just had my 2 hour glucose tolerance and failed:88 fasting (95 cut off)190 one hour (180 cut off)153 two hour (155 cut off)My A1C was tested at 10 weeks and it was a 5.1Im concerned that I have/have had regular type 2 and this is not something pregnancy related.. are these number indicative of type 2? My doctors say no but im still concerned
